Posts.Content: Aug 17, 2008 08:01AM Genia wrote: It honestly wouldn't have been that bad if the lidocaine had worked.  Now I'm wondering what ELSE they can give me instead of that because apparently it doesn't do the job for me...... :( In this day and age.....if everything worked the way it was supposed to....there SHOULD be minimal pain involved.  I'm just glad it's over.....or at least that part anyway....lol Thanks for your replies.....hugsss
Posts.Title: What a day.... Genia Shirlann

Posts.Content: Aug 17, 2008 02:53PM - edited Aug 17, 2008 02:55PM by Genia Susan.....you sound exactly like me.  LOLOL....I'm thinking they should have at least MENTIONED this BEFORE this started....in other words they could have said.....we will give you lidocaine....but it doesn't always work......so you may feel as if someone is tearing part of your breast tissue out with an ice pick!!!!  And when we are finished......while the guidewire is still in there......you are gonna feel like someone hit you in the breast with a ballbat!!!!  Oh....and you are gonna feel us pull that wire out too......because YOUR LIDOCAINE ISN'T WORKING RIGHT!!!!!   lmao.....just a small bit of info they FORGOT to tell me......... OMG I stll cringe when I think about how much that hurt......*shiver*
Posts.Title: What a day.... Genia Shirlann

Posts.Content: Genia wrote: I went to see the new surgeon today......I love him and I think he is terrific......he was very upset because I have been waiting since June 13th to get to the point I'm at right now.   He said that should never have happened.  He also said the other surgeon should NOT have diagnosed my cancer without a biopsy being done.  He feels sure this is cancer and he found a very prominent lymph node under my arm this time. So he sent me over to the imaging center to have a core needle biopsy done.  And while they were doing that......they did a fine needle aspiration of the lymph node too.   I'm in some pain right now....which he said I would be simply because of the areas that he biopsied.  I took something for pain....so I'm gonna lay down.   Oh yea....ya know how the other surgeon said I had lobular?  This surgeons says it is UNLIKELY that it is lobular.  He said and I quote "I don't CARE which kind of cancer it is......we need to get started with the treatmens because you have gone long enough without anything being done"   And after we get the biopsy back we will KNOW for sure WHICH kind it is.  He seemed very concerned and was also aggravated because the other surgeon had me playing the waiting game. So that's where it stands right now........naptime for me!   lol Hugs to you.......love you all The 11th Commandment.......THOU SHALT LAUGH........F.R.O.G! Dx 7/24/2008, ILC, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: What a day.... Genia Shirlann

Posts.Content: Aug 15, 2008 11:18AM Genia wrote: I'm feeling much better today.  Still some soreness.....but not bad.  The lady at the imaging center called to check on me this morning.  She said and I quote "you are one of the rare ones that the lidocaine didn't work well on".  I thought.........YA RECKON????  lolol......maybe THAT was the reason I could FEEL every snip towards the end and immediately felt like someone had hit me with a ballbat.......DUH!!!!! From everything I had been reading on here.....it wasn't supposed to be that bad.  And had the lidocaine WORKED right.....it would have been fine!   I must say it was one of the worst procedures I've ever gone through.......  Hugs and thanks to all of you........Genia

Posts.Content: Genia wrote: I'm finally feeling better....... I called my Dr.'s office because my diarrhea got sooo bad I had a bowel movement in my sleep and it woke me up...... They said I had C-Diff.......I think that's what it's called and how you spell it.  He said he doubted the diarrhea was due to the chemo.  I was on an antibiotic for an infection in my port about 3 days before I started the chemo.....and he seems to think that my bowels never had time to recoup after the antibiotic stopped.........and the chemo started!   So it just keeps getting worse and worse.  So now I'm on Flagyl for 7 days now......... Should get all straightened out in time for my next round.......ugh!!!! hugsssss   The 11th Commandment.......THOU SHALT LAUGH........F.R.O.G! Dx 7/24/2008, ILC, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: What to expect with breast MRI? slyspyder Genia

Posts.Content: Genia wrote: This message board has been a God send for me!!!!   I sit and read......when I get down or upset.  You all have NO idea just how much hope you give me every single day.  I read your posts and there's always something there that I can relate to or I'm feeling at the moment! I see the the other surgeon this Thursday.  I'm sure he will want to put the port in and start chemo soon.....then again......he may want to do surgery first.  The other surgeon was gonna do 4 rounds of chemo before the surgery because my tumor is so big.  So I won't really know what his game plan is until I see him. I've been very DOWN the past 2 days.  I'm sure it's part of it.......but I'm not a down person......so this is getting to me.  Thank God for prozac and ativan!   Again....thank you......from the bottom of my heart!!!!    The 11th Commandment.......THOU SHALT LAUGH........F.R.O.G!
